pullRequest.body:
There is a `Nat.log2` function in Lean (Init/Data/Nat/Log2.lean), which corresponds to the floor log base 2 over Nat.
This PR proves this connection and uses it to show that `Nat.log b n â‰¤ n` as a simple upper bound on Nat.log.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10715380185/job/29710721816)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10715380185/job/29710722204)
I suggest using ` induction ... with` here as well
I attempted to the format you suggested but for whatever name I give after |, it seems to throw error "invalid alternative name 'n' " or such. Would it be possible to get a more detailed help?

This works, either here or right after `pow_log_le_self`:
```lean
lemma log_lt_self (b : â„•) {x : â„•} (hx : x â‰  0) : log b x < x :=
  match le_or_lt b 1 with
  | .inl h => log_of_left_le_one h x â–¸ Nat.pos_iff_ne_zero.2 hx
  | .inr h => log_lt_of_lt_pow hx <| lt_pow_self h _

lemma log_le_self (b x : â„•) : log b x â‰¤ x :=
  if hx : x = 0 then by simp [hx]
  else (log_lt_self b hx).le
```

Here's a golf.
```suggestion
  rcases eq_or_ne n 0 with rfl | hn
  Â· rw [log2_zero, log_zero_right]
  apply eq_of_forall_le_iff
  intro m
  rw [Nat.le_log2 hn, â† Nat.pow_le_iff_le_log Nat.one_lt_two hn]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Nat/log): Nat.log 2 = Nat.log2 and linear bound on Nat.log
